Sharon Barak - the woman that fixed plastic

Plastic pollution is a serious problem. It is not secret by now that plastic is hurting the environment.

Every year we produce 300, 000, 000 tons of plastic and 50% of that is single use plastic as bottles.

You use it once for a few seconds, you throw it away and it stays in nature for hundreds of years, in

the forests and in the oceans causing harm for everyone.

Single use plastic is a problem. That is where Sharon comes in. She is a chemical engineer who used

to work at a plastic company until she quit to go solve the plastic problem. After years of research

and hard work she made a unique product that looks like plastic, that functions like plastic, but it is

not really plastic. Because her product is not plastic at all but it looks and feels like one.

When she was asked by a youtuber who made video about her and her invention how many

materials did she mix, she answered a lot.

When you put her product in the water, it dissolves within minutes. After you finish using it and you

throw it away it will just go back, break down and bio-degrade in nature and real plastic stays the

same! Her product is so environmentally friendly that even when it disappears in water you can still

drink it.

From this material, Sharon can make plastic for packaging, for food covering, for bottles and for

anything. When it works, it really has the potential to solve the plastic problem and make the world a

better and cleaner place.

Now Sharon has assembled a team in Israel to take over the world with her invention. She says that it

is very exciting for her to do it in her way and to know that it can really be an influence. Together

with her partner, Sharon is working every single day to make the world better for her children.

You can visit Solutum of which Sharon is co founder and also the Youtube channel of Nuseir Yassin who made this video.
